p: TRPA1 and TRPV1 channels have six transmembrane (S1â€“S6) polypeptide subunits, permeable to cations via a pore formed by a tetramer assembly [ 142]. The hydrophobic pore region is located between S5 and S6 [ 143]. TRPA1 and TRPV1 contain ankyrin repeat motifs at the intracellular N-terminal; however, TRPA1 possess a remarkably high number of ankyrins [ 4]. TRPV1 and TRPA1 agonists both interact with binding sites to activate the channels.
